DataElement.preferredName: Tissue Donor Opportunistic Infection HIV Infection Or High Risk Behavior Evidence Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: An indication of whether the history physical examination medical records or autopsy report reveal other evidence of HIV infection or high-risk behavior such as opportunistic infections as provided by the primary history source.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Tissue Donor Opportunistic Infection HIV Infection Or High Risk Behavior Evidence
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Someone who gives blood or tissue or an organ to be used in another person._An infection caused by an organism which becomes pathogenic under certain conditions, e.g., during immunosuppression._any state accompanied by evidence of HIV in the body (positive test for HIV genome, cDNA, proteins, antigens, or antibodies); may be medically asymptomatic or symptomatic; prefer AIDS when appropriate._An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise._The potential future harm that may arise from some present action or attribute or condition is almost certain._human or animal activity studied in terms of motivation, direction, result, emotion, perception, or etiology._Knowledge on which to base belief.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Someone who gives blood or tissue or an organ to be used in another person.

Concepts.definition: Someone who gives blood or tissue or an organ to be used in another person.

Property.preferredName: Opportunistic Infection HIV Infection Or High Risk Behavior Evidence
Property.preferredDefinition: An infection caused by an organism which becomes pathogenic under certain conditions, e.g., during immunosuppression.:any state accompanied by evidence of HIV in the body (positive test for HIV genome, cDNA, proteins, antigens, or antibodies); may be medically asymptomatic or symptomatic; prefer AIDS when appropriate.:An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.:The potential future harm that may arise from some present action or attribute or condition is almost certain.:human or animal activity studied in terms of motivation, direction, result, emotion, perception, or etiology.:Knowledge on which to base belief.

Concepts.definition: Infection caused by an organism that is capable of causing disease in immunocompromised patients only (e.g. HIV-positive or transplanted patients).--2004
An infection caused by the human immunodeficiency virus.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
The potential future harm that may arise from some present action or attribute or condition is almost certain.
The actions or reactions of an object or organism, usually in relation to the environment or surrounding world of stimuli.
Knowledge on which to base belief.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no/unknown.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no/unknown.

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, or unknown.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.2.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Retired DBW 4-27-2016 per Tina Taylor approved by Dianne Reeves

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. 3/35/2016 jk removed "indeterminate" value that was added in error. 7/7/2021wz: added ALT VM name for HOPE-CARE project.

ReferenceDocuments.name: History, physical examination
ReferenceDocuments.description: History, physical examination, medical records or autopsy reports reveal other evidence of HIV infection or high-risk behavior such as:  Opportunistic infections
